WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex issues and suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some issues and feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
How is typescript published to npm?
https://www.npmjs.org/package/typescript

Would be useful to generate ~ 'TypeScript\built\local\npm\typescript.js'

Which just appends:
modules.exports = TypeScript;

Attached is a patch which automatically does this if in a commonjs/node environment.

Right now, I have to manually update ~
C:\Users\Jonathan\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\typescript\bin\typescript.js

Comments.Message:
Dug into .npmignore & Jakefile
I guess the proper way would be to append modules.exports = TypeScript; in Jakefile?

Is the there any reason not to export the api?
